question: Janet's duck lays 16 eggs a day. She eats three at breakfast every morning and bakes her duck friends four eggs a day. She sells the rest at the farmers' market every day for $2 per duck egg. How much money does she make in dollars a day at the farmers' market?
A gown uses 2 cords of blue thread and half that amount of white thread. How many cords does it use altogether?

Josha decides to try to buy the house and sell it at a profit. He buys the house for $80,000 and spends $50,000 renovating it. This increased the value of the house by 150%. How much profit did he make?
James decides to run 3 short runs 3 times a week. He runs 60 meters for each short run. How many meters does he run in total per week?

Every day, Wendi feeds each of her chickens three cups of chicken food, a mixture of seeds, insects, and vegetables to help maintain their good health. She feeds the chickens their food in three separate meals. In the morning, she gives her chickens 15 cups of food. In the afternoon, she gives her chickens another 25 cups of food. How many cups of food does she need to give her chickens at the last meal of the day if Wendi's chickens number 20?

Kylar went to the store to buy mirrors for her new building. One mirror costs $5, but each second mirror costs only 60% of the price. Kylar wants to buy 16 mirrors. How much does she have to pay for those mirrors?
gpt-4: kylar has to pay $104 for those mirrors.

question: Toulouse has twice as many sheep as Charleston. Charleston has 4 times as many sheep as Seattle. How many sheep do Toulouse, Charleston, and Seattle have combined if Seattle has 20 sheep?
gpt-4: toulouse, charleston, and seattle have a combined total of 260 sheep.

question: Carla downloads a 200 GB file. Normally she can download 2 GB every minute, but at 40% of the download, Windows forces a restart to load updates, and it takes 20 minutes. Then Carla has to start downloading again from the beginning. How long will it take her to download the file?

John drives for 3 hours at 60 miles per hour and then turns around because he realizes that he has forgotten something very important at home. He tries to get home for 4 hours but spends the first 2 hours in traffic. He spends the next half hour driving at 30 miles per hour, before being able to drive the remaining 4 hours at 80 miles per hour. What is the distance from home at the end of those 4 hours?
Eliza's hourly rate for the first 40 hours she works each week is $10. She also receives 1.2 times her regular hourly overtime pay. If Eliza worked 45 hours this week, what is her weekly earnings?

A new app was downloaded 60 times in the first month. The number of downloads in the second month was three times the number of downloads in the first month, but fell by 30% in the third month. How many times was the app downloaded in total during the three months?
Toula went to the bakery and bought a variety of biscuits: 3 dozen doughnuts for $68 a dozen, 2 dozen cupcakes for $80 a dozen, and 6 dozen cupcakes for $55 a dozen.

Carlos plants a lemon tree. It will cost $90 to plant it. Each year it will produce 7 lemons, which he can sell for $1.5 each. The cost of watering and feeding the tree each year is $3. How many years will it take before he starts to make a profit from the lemon?

In a dance class of 20 students, 20% enrolled in modern dance, 25% of the rest enrolled in jazz dance, and the rest enrolled in brass dance. What percentage of all students enrolled in brass dance?

His financial advisor estimates that the jewelry market will rise to 2.5% while the electronics market will rise to 1.2% within the same month. If the trader wants to have the highest profits by the end of this month by making an option, how much profit will this be?

Jill is paid $20 an hour to coach and $30 an hour to coach the fans. If she works 50 weeks a year, 35 hours a week as a teacher and 15 hours as a coach, what is her annual salary?
Claire prepares 3 almond eggs every morning during the feast. How many dozen eggs will she eat after 4 weeks?

Marissa walks a distance of 12 miles [12 km]. It took her 1 hour to walk the first 4 miles, then another hour to walk the next 2 miles. If she wants her average speed to be 4 miles per hour, what speed (in miles per hour) would she need to walk the rest of the way?

I have 10 liters of orange juice that is two thirds water and I would prefer to add it to 15 liters of pineapple juice that is three thirds water. But when I pour it, I have poured out one liter of orange juice. How much water is in the remaining 24 liters?
Raymond and Samantha are cousins. Raymond was born 6 years before Samantha. Raymond had a son at the age of 23. If Samantha is now 31 years old, how many years ago was Raymond's son born?

Billy sells DVDs. He has 8 customers on Tuesday. His first 3 customers buy one DVD each. His next 2 customers buy 2 DVDs each. His last 3 customers don't buy any DVDs. How many DVDs did Billy sell on Tuesday?

John cares for 10 dogs, each of which he spends .5 hours a day walking and handling. How many hours a week does he spend caring for them?
Gretchen has 110 coins. There are 30 gold coins more than silver coins. How many gold coins does Gretchen have?

The giant ape, Perg, lived on the highest point of Mount Farbo, most aggressive to anything within 1,000 feet. But when Polly caught the jewel, she was able to throw the spear three times as far as when she was not holding the jewel. Holding the jewel, how far beyond the ape's rays would Polly stand and still be able to hit the ape with the golden spear?

By the end of the evening, after the guests had taken and eaten their pieces, there were 14 pieces of cake left over. How many pieces did the guests eat?

Charlie wants to sell beeswax candles. For every pound of beeswax, he can make 10 candles. A pound of beeswax and pasta all cost $10.00. If he sells each candle for $2.00 each, what would his total profit from making and selling 20 candles be?

Last week, she wrote 5 posts on Monday and on Tuesday she wrote 2/5 more posts on Monday. On Wednesday, she wrote twice as many posts as she did on Tuesday. Find the total number of hours she spent writing articles in those three days.
gpt-4: meredith spent 52 hours writing articles in those three days.
